intro: Murdannia scapiflora, commonly known as the scapiflorous murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base. Its flowers are typically small, white or pale pink, and are arranged in clusters at the top of the stem. Murdannia scapiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
